page.title: 13The Notable Event
page.content: On the 27th April 1985 the University had a 21st Anniversary Open Day from 10am to 6 pm. It was packed with 17,000 visitors. The special attractions were 'Deal with a world crisis', 'Exploit the Morecambe gas field', 'Build a Doric arch','Visit the coldest place on earth' and many side shows which included film, theatre, music, scientific demonstrations, sport, children's activities and refreshments. They had so many visitors that extra car parks were needed on the grassy areas. The weather was rather poor and it was supposed to have affected the number of people attending the open day. The last open day in 1980 had 1,000 more people and it was a much nicer day.
